info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued October 18 at 12:51PM EDT until October 19 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low humidity, which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening.
* Affected Area...All of southern Vermont, including Bennington and Windham Counties.
* Timing...12 PM to 10 PM Sunday. The lowest humidities and strongest winds will occur between 1 PM and 8 PM on Sunday.
* Winds...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph.
* Relative Humidity...As low as 35 to 40 percent, but localized higher values across the southern Green Mountains..
* Temperatures...Highs in the mid 60s to lower 70s.
* Impacts...If any fires were to start the weather and fuel conditions could cause fires to quickly get out of control and be difficult to contain.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

parameter.value: FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHERN VERMONT

area.areaDesc: Southern Taconics; Southern Greens; Lower Connecticut Valley South
